name: Boros Mastiff
text: Battalion — Whenever Boros Mastiff and at least two other creatures attack, Boros Mastiff gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

name: Boros Reckoner
text:
Whenever Boros Reckoner is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target creature or player.
{R/W}: Boros Reckoner gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Imagine a thunderstorm that's also a tactical genius. That's him."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

"Imagine a thunderstorm that's also a tactical genius. That's him."
—Dars Gostok, Firefist captain

name: Boros Recruit
text:
({R/W} can be paid with either {R} or {W}.)
First strike

editions.flavor:
"Look at this goblin, once wild, untamed, and full of idiocy. The Boros have given him the skill of a soldier and focused his heart with a single cause."
—Razia

name: Boros Signet
text: {1}, {T}: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:

text: Double strike

name: Borrowed Grace

Escalate {1}{W} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —
• Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

text:

Choose one or both —
• Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

text:
Escalate {2} (Pay this cost for each mode chosen beyond the first.)
Choose one or both —

• Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

name: Borrowing 100,000 Arrows
text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.

text: Borrowing the East Wind deals X damage to each creature with horsemanship and each player.

text:
Boseiju, Who Shelters All enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Pay 2 life: Add {C} to your mana pool. If that mana is spent on an instant or sorcery spell, that spell can't be countered by spells or abilities.

name: Bosh, Iron Golem
text:
Trample
{3}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Bosh, Iron Golem deals damage equal to the sacrificed artifact's converted mana cost to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets of his past.
As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets of his past.
As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets buried deep in his memory.

name: Bosh, Iron Golem Avatar
text: {X}, Sacrifice an artifact with converted mana cost X: Bosh, Iron Golem Avatar deals X damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: MRD Participation Avatar

name: Bösium Strip
text: {3}, {T}: Until end of turn, if the top card of your graveyard is an instant or sorcery card, you may cast that card. If a card cast this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

name: Bosk Banneret
text: Treefolk spells and Shaman spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

editions.flavor: Deep in a murmuring bosk, where the trees' memories span centuries, the simple banner of green and copper signifies an elder whose rings number more than a faerie's days.

name: Bosom Buddy
text: Whenever you play a spell, you may gain ½ life for each word in that spell's name.

editions.flavor: "Step 1: I believe in a power and toughness greater than myself . . . ."

name: Botanical Sanctum
text:
Botanical Sanctum enters the battlefield tapped unless you control two or fewer other lands.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Life inspires technology, which expands life's domain.

name: Bottled Cloister
text:
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, exile all cards from your hand face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return all cards you own exiled with Bottled Cloister to your hand, then draw a card.

name: Bottle Gnomes
text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

name: Bottomless Pit
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player discards a card at random.

editions.flavor:
"I'm sure it came with the place. I don't think you build one on purpose."
—Gerrard

name: Bottomless Vault
text:
Bottomless Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
You may choose not to untap Bottomless Vault during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Bottomless Vault is tapped, put a storage counter on it.
{T}, Remove any number of storage counters from Bottomless Vault: Add {B} to your mana pool for each storage counter removed this way.

name: Boulderfall
text: Boulderfall deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

editions.flavor:
"Defeating the Meletians was not so difficult. I needed only to move a mountain."
—Eocles, oracle of Purphoros

name: Boulder Salvo
text:
Surge {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Boulder Salvo deals 4 damage to target creature.

editions.flavor:
"If someone claims the sky is falling, I listen."
—Yon Basrel, Oran-Rief survivalist

name: Bouncing Beebles
text: Bouncing Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an artifact.

editions.flavor: Beebles are frequently hurled against stone surfaces at high speed but always zing back into the air with a giggle.

name: Bound
text: Sacrifice a creature. Return up to X cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of colors that creature was. Exile this card.

name: Bound by Moonsilver
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack, block, or transform.
Sacrifice another permanent: Attach Bound by Moonsilver to target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.

name: Bounding Krasis
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Bounding Krasis enters the battlefield, you may tap or untap target creature.

editions.flavor: Unpredictable as a storm and destructive as a tidal wave.

name: Bound in Silence
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

editions.flavor: A fight put off forever is already won.
A fight put off forever is already won.

name: Boundless Realms
text: Search your library for up to X basic land cards, where X is the number of lands you control, and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Planeswalking cannot be taught. Either you see the doors or you do not."
—Nissa Revane

name: Bounteous Kirin
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may gain life equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: Even the most benevolent and life-giving of kami joined the war against the mortal world, but only with heavy and sorrowful hearts.

name: Bountiful Harvest
text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.

editions.flavor: Following the sun's cycle, harvest season comes once a year—unless the druids bid the sun behave otherwise.

"When we fail to see the beauty in every tree, we are no better than humans."
—Saelia, elvish scout

"When we fail to see the beauty in every tree, we are no better than humans."
—Saelia, elvish scout

name: Bounty Hunter
text:
{T}: Put a bounty counter on target nonblack creature.
{T}: Destroy target creature with a bounty counter on it.

editions.flavor: "Once they've marked you," Starke said, "the world is made of glass."

name: Bounty of the Hunt
text:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay Bounty of the Hunt's mana cost.
Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each +1/+1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a +1/+1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

name: Bounty of the Luxa
text: At the beginning of your precombat main phase, remove all flood counters from Bounty of the Luxa. If no counters were removed this way, put a flood counter on Bounty of the Luxa and draw a card. Otherwise, add {C}{G}{U} to your mana pool.

name: Bower Passage
text: Creatures with flying can't block creatures you control.

editions.flavor: In the darkest hours, some denied Avacyn. Now the Kessig wilds are their only haven.

text:
Attacking creatures you control have deathtouch.

• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

• You gain 3 life.
• Put up to four target cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Brace for Impact
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target multicolored creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor: Flesh can be tempered by spellcraft and forged ever stronger by the hammers of foes.

text:
When Brackwater Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

text:
Flying
Whenever Brago, King Eternal deals combat damage to a player, exile any number of target nonland permanents you control, then return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.

editions.flavor: "My rule persists beyond death itself."

name: Brago's Favor
text:
Hidden agenda (Start the game with this conspiracy face down in the command zone and secretly name a card. You may turn this conspiracy face up any time and reveal the chosen name.)
Spells with the chosen name you cast cost {1} less to cast.

name: Brago's Representative
text: While voting, you get an additional vote. (The votes can be for different choices or for the same choice.)

editions.flavor: On Fiora, no matter is settled until King Brago offers an opinion.

name: Braid of Fire
text: Cumulative upkeep—Add {R} to your mana pool. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

editions.flavor: "To a trained mind, the cold is but a momentary distraction."

name: Braids, Cabal Minion
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.

editions.flavor: "Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."
"Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."

name: Braids, Conjurer Adept
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may put an artifact, creature, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

editions.flavor: The rifted multiverse became a sea of conflicting realities, each peopled by possible versions of every living being.

name: Braids, Conjurer Adept Avatar
text:
{2}: Each player may put a land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield tapped.
{3}: Each player may put a noncreature artifact card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

text:

text:
Trample

text:

text:
Enchant creature

name: Brassclaw Orcs

editions.flavor:
"A whole skin is worth a thousand victories."

"A whole skin is worth a thousand victories."
—Orcish Veteran of the Battle of Montford

—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV

Flying
Brass Gnat doesn't untap during your untap step.

name: Breaking Wave
text:
You may cast Breaking Wave as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Simultaneously untap all tapped creatures and tap all untapped creatures.

name: Breakneck Rider
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Breakneck Rider.

editions.flavor: Only the most skillful riders brave the Breakneck Ride through Kessig.

name: Break of Day
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, those creatures gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

name: Break Open
text: Turn target face-down creature an opponent controls face up.

editions.flavor: There are two ways to resolve puzzling situations: thoughtful contemplation or force. After thoughtful contemplation, most barbarians choose force.

name: Breakthrough
text: Draw four cards, then choose X cards in your hand and discard the rest.

editions.flavor: The ideas came flooding in so fast that they couldn't all be contained.
The ideas came flooding in so fast that they couldn't all be contained.

name: Break Through the Line
text: {R}: Target creature with power 2 or less gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

editions.flavor:
"If the Mardu were more in tune with their beasts, they would not scare so easily."
—Jilaya, Temur whisperer

name: Breath of Darigaaz
text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Breath of Darigaaz deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. If Breath of Darigaaz was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player instead.

name: Breath of Dreams
text:
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Green creatures have "Cumulative upkeep {1}."

editions.flavor:
"Get up, blast you! They're attacking! Why are you all so slow?"
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
